title: DNA Is Key to Identifying Possible Tulsa Race Massacre Victims
sub_head: Researchers found 14 remains last year; forensic lab to create webpage to try to connect with possible relatives
body:
Researchers exhuming what could be victims of the Tulsa race massacre of 1921 are asking possible descendants of victims to submit DNA samples to help identify the remains.
Fourteen separate remains found in unmarked graves were exhumed and are being examined as part of an investigation reopened in 2018 by the city of Tulsa, Okla., to find victims of the massacre.
